About Us


Established in the year 2013, Horizon Infra, today, leading manufacturer of CLC Light weight Blocks, Interlocking Bricks and Interlocking paver blocks in Gulbarga. In coming day’s company is planning to promote new Business in Construction Sector like Engineering Procurement Construction(EPC) works for Residential and Commercial Buildings. Skilled & unskilled manpower supply for all type of Building works.

Horizon Infrastructure manufacturing unit located at Nandur Industrial Area which is 6KM from Gulbarga City, towards Shahabad. Horizon Infra manufactures CLC blocks with latest innovation technology under the Brand name "SmartBlock". Horizon Infra Manufacturing unit spread over 3,500 Sq.ft areas and this manufacturing unit was established after 6 months of R&D works on foam concrete technology.

Our Products: Cellular Light Weight Concrete Blocks(Smart Blocks)


Global warming and Environmental pollution is now a global concern. Cellular Light Weight Technology blocks can be used as an alternative to the red bricks, to reduce Environmental pollution and Global warming. Smart blocks are environment friendly. The energy consumed in the production of Smart blocks is only a fraction compared to the production of red bricks and emits no pollutants and creates no toxic products or by products. It is produced by initially making slurry of Cement + Fly Ash + Water, which is further mixed with the addition of pre-formed stable foam in an ordinary concrete mixer under ambient conditions. The compressive strength of smart blocks is more than the compressive strength of conventional clay bricks.The addition of foam to the concrete mixture creates millions of tiny voids or cells in the material, hence the name Cellular Concrete.

Cellular Lightweight Concrete can be produced in a wide range of densities from 400 kg/m3 to 1,800 kg/m3 to suit different applications: -

  • The lower densities of 400 –600 kg/m3 are ideal for thermal insulation applications. Smart Block’s fire, termite, water-proofing feature and environment friendliness make it a far superior alternative to the commonly used Thermocole, glasswool, woodwool etc.
  • The density range 800-1000 kg/m3 is utilized for making pre-cast blocks (600x200x100/150/200/225 mm) for non-load-bearing walling masonry in framed structures.
  • The CLC range from 1200kg/m3 (Crushing strength 65 kg/cm2) to 1800 kg/m3 (Crushing strength 250 kg/cm2) is structural grade material utilized for:-

    • In-situ casting of structural (load-bearing) walls and roofs of low rise individual or group housing schemes. or
    • Manufacture of reinforced structural cladding or partitioning panels. Or for
    • Making pre-cast blocks (600x200x100/150/200/225 mm) for load-bearing walling masonry for low-rise buildings.

Advantages :

  • Light in weight - Reduces the dead load of the structure.
  • Faster project completion.
  • Saves steel with no compromise on safety.
  • Big savings in plastering due to even walls.
  • Maximum compressive strength, crack resistant.
  • Excellent thermal insulation - Cool summers / Warm winters.
  • Environmental and Eco friendly.
  • Can be Cut, Nailed, Drilled and Chipped.
  • Excellent acoustic barrier with maximum fire resistance
  • Good Sound Reduction
  • Less Water Absorption
  • Enhances Carpet Area
  • Earthquake Resistant
  • Eco Friendly
  • Ease of Workability
    •

Technical Specifications:

Smart Blocks are available in 3 grade strengths:

  • Grade A: These are used as load bearing units & have a brick density in the range of 1,200 kg/Cum – 1,800 kg/Cum.
  • Grade B: These are used as non-Load bearing units & have a brick density in the range of 700 – 1,000 kg/Cum.
  • Grade C: These are used for providing thermal insulation & have a brick density in the range of 400 – 600 kg/Cum.

Recommended usage of Smart Block's based on density:

  • Density 300-600 kg/m³: This density is primarily applied for thermal insulation or fire protection. It uses only cement (or little flyash), water and foam and can easily be pumped. Foam generators allow the production of stiff foam for slopes to be applied on roof-tops.
  • Density 700-800 kg/m³: Is also used for void-filling, such as an landscaping (above underground construction), to fill voids behind archways and refurbishing of damaged sewerage systems. It is also been used to produce building blocks.
  • Density 900-1100 kg/m³: Serves to fore mostly produce blocks and other non-load bearing building elements such as balcony railings, partitions, parapets and fence walls etc.
  • Density 1200-1400 kg/m³: Are the most commonly densities for prefab and cast in situ walls, load-bearing and non-load-bearing. It is also successfully used for floor screeds (sound and insulation plus weight reduction).
  • Density 1600-1800 kg/m³: would be recommended for slabs and other load-bearing building elements where higher strength is obligatory.
FAQ's    Cost Comparison    Technical Specifications of Smart block

Our Upcoming Products

Color Pigment Smart Blocks

Color Pigment Smart Blocks

Fibre Reinforced Smart Blocks

Fibre Reinforced Smart Blocks

Colour pigment Smart Blocks, which is mainly used for Building Architechtural and Interor design purpose.

Premium Services of Engineering, Procurement and Construction


Horizon infrastructure offer turnkey services from supply of individual building materials to undertaking turnkey EPC Contracts for Residential and Commercial buildings constructions across all over India. Backed by a professional team of senior executives each with many years of experience of working in Design & construction industry and dedicated group of young engineers of the company has ability to undertake complete EPC projects offering reliable and cost effective solutions in Residential and commercial building construction sector.

Horizon infrastructure offers comprehensive services for the Residential and commercial building construction and the activities include:

  • Optimization studies
  • Detailed design and Engineering
  • Procurement assistance
  • Inspection and expediting
  • Supervision of Erection and Construction
  • Project Management and implementation
  • Renovation and modernization

Principal activities and scope of work for EPC Contracts:

  • Design & Engineering:

    • Feasibility studies
    • Architectural design
    • Structural design
    • Cost engineering
    • Material estimation
    • Detailed engineering includes electrification and plumbing engineering

  • Procurement:

    • Horizon infra undertakes the responsibility to procure the required materials for completion of project, strictly as per the project schedule and the specifications made by the Engineering Department from the reputed vendors spread all over the country. The procurement activities include:

    • Technical evaluations
    • Vendor negotiations
    • Inspections and expediting

  • Construction:

    • The construction of activity is completed as per the Bar chart made for project completion, meeting all the specifications requirements of the consultants and statutory authorities.

    Co-ordination with consultancy agencies: In the execution of various projects, we have close interaction and association with many of the leading consultancy agencies in India.

    Statutory approvals/ clearances: We closely associate with the client and help him in obtaining statutory approvals from authorities like Municipal corporation/ state government and regional electricity authorities, etc. for to start up your project.


Contact Us: Our goal is to reply to every email within two business days.


Copyright © Company 2013

Horizon Infrastructure

Nandoor Industrial Area, Gulbarga
Karnataka, India.
